docs.snippet: Everything Kerr wanted in his first N.B.A. head coaching job — the terms, the type of team and locality — pointed him away from the Knicks and toward Golden State....
docs.lead_paragraph: Everything Kerr wanted in his first N.B.A. head coaching job — the terms, the type of team and locality — pointed him away from the Knicks and toward Golden State.
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Pre Basketball column holds that by choosing to take head coaching job at Golden State Warriors over the New York Knicks, Steve Kerr chose to follow the path of least tumult, despite being wooed to come to New York by his mentor Phil Jackson.

headline.main: With Warriors, Steve Kerr Follows the Path of Least Tumult
headline.print_headline: With Warriors, Kerr Follows the Path of Least Tumult

docs.snippet: After losing Steve Kerr, his first choice for Knicks coach, to the Warriors, Jackson is turning his consideration to other members of his inner circle....
docs.lead_paragraph: After losing Steve Kerr, his first choice for Knicks coach, to the Warriors, Jackson is turning his consideration to other members of his inner circle.
docs.abstract: Analysis; New York Knicks president Phil Jackson appears to want a coach who will operate as an extension of himself, someone familiar with the triangle, perhaps someone he has coached.

headline.main: Phil Jackson’s Focus: His Inner Circle and the Triangle
headline.print_headline: Jackson’s Focus: His Inner Circle and the Triangle

docs.snippet: The league, which barred Donald Sterling for life last month for making racist comments, received notice on Thursday that Sterling would not pay a $2.5 million fine....
docs.lead_paragraph: The league, which barred Donald Sterling for life last month for making racist comments, received notice on Thursday that Sterling would not pay a $2.5 million fine.
docs.abstract: Embattled Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling, who expressed contrition for making racist comments, does not plan to go away quietly; tells NBA he will not pay $2.5 million fine.

docs.snippet: Incidents in Nets-Heat and Clippers-Thunder playoff games are the latest to call attention to what officials are allowed to review....
docs.lead_paragraph: Incidents in Nets-Heat and Clippers-Thunder playoff games are the latest to call attention to what officials are allowed to review.
docs.abstract: Incidents in Brooklyn Nets-Miami Heat and Los Angeles Clippers-Oklahoma City Thunder playoff games are the latest to call attention to what officials are allowed to review; are likely to prompt changes in the replay system; NBA fines Clippers coach Doc Rivers over his diatribe after officials did not overturn pivotal call in his team's playoff loss.
